channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: パブリック・インテグリティ・センターはなぜ崩壊したのか：幹部の高い離職率、欠陥のある理事会、限られたプログラム資金、戦略的な失策（Richard J. Tofel/Second Rough Draft）
item.description:
Richard J. Tofel / Second Rough Draft:
Why the Center for Public Integrity fell apart: high executive turnover, a flawed board of directors, narrow program funding, and strategic missteps  —  Reflections after talking with former leaders  —  Welcome to Second Rough Draft, a newsletter about journalism in our time, how it …

item.title: ソーススペイン高等法院、テレグラムの利用停止を命令 メディア各社が申し立て（ロイター通信）
item.description:
Reuters:
Source: Spain's High Court orders the suspension of Telegram after media companies complained it was allowing users to upload their content without permission  —  Spain's High Court has ordered the suspension of messaging app Telegram's services in the country after media companies complained …

item.title: SAG-AFTRA会員、声優の賃上げとAI保護を含むTVアニメ新3年契約を批准、95％が賛成票を投じる（Katie Campione/Deadline）
item.description:
Katie Campione / Deadline:
SAG-AFTRA members ratify new three-year TV animation agreements, which include wage increases and AI protections for voice actors, with 95% voting in favor  —  SAG-AFTRA members today ratified the 2023 Television Animation Agreement and the 2023 Basic Cable Animation Agreement with the Alliance …

item.title: ロングビーチポスト紙、非営利団体への組織変更と従業員の組合結成の動きに伴い従業員を解雇、情報源：17人から8人に削減（Christi Carras/Los Angeles Times）
item.description:
Christi Carras / Los Angeles Times:
The Long Beach Post lays off staffers following a switch to nonprofit ownership and amid employees' efforts to unionize; source: staff was cut from 17 to eight  —  The Long Beach Media Guild announced Friday that at least 60% of the bargaining unit received layoff notices shortly …

item.title: ニール・ヤングに続き、2022年にワクチンに関する「嘘」に抗議して削除したジョニ・ミッチェルの楽曲がスポティファイに復帰（Ben Sisario/New York Times）
item.description:
Ben Sisario / New York Times:
Joni Mitchell's music returns to Spotify after she removed it in 2022 in protest of what she called “lies” about vaccines on the platform, following Neil Young  —  Her music has quietly reappeared on the streaming service, two years after a departure over what she called “lies” about Covid-19 vaccines in podcasts.

item.title: インスタグラムとスレッドでは、メタ社が2月に発表した政治的コンテンツを制限する新しい設定がデフォルトで有効になっていることに不満を持つユーザーもいる（Ashley Belanger/Ars Technica）。
item.description:
Ashley Belanger / Ars Technica:
Some users on Instagram and Threads complain that a new setting to limit political content, which Meta announced in February, is enabled by default  —  Instagram never directly told users it was limiting political content by default.  —  Instagram users have started complaining on X …

item.title: プライム・ビデオがアフリカで失敗した理由を映画制作者、批評家、ユーザーが詳述 アマゾンは2024年1月にスタッフを解雇し、アフリカ大陸での事業を縮小（Jesusegun Alagbe/Rest of World）
item.description:
Jesusegun Alagbe / Rest of World:
Filmmakers, critics, and users detail why Prime Video failed in Africa; Amazon laid off staff and scaled back operations on the continent in January 2024  —  Filmmakers, critics, and users blame the platform's struggle in Africa on poor user experience, a lack of local content, and mediocre publicity.

item.title: NFLのAFCワイルドカード戦から7週間後、この試合のためにピーコックに加入した3M人のうち71％が加入を継続（アンテナ）
item.description:
Antenna:
Seven weeks after the AFC Wild Card NFL game, 71% of the 3M people who subscribed to Peacock for the game remained subscribed  —  The first two months of 2024 brought some big moments for streaming and sports: in January, Peacock's exclusive broadcast of the NFL AFC Wild Card Game and Paramount+'s broadcast of Super Bowl LVIII.

item.title: グーグルの出版社向けジェネレーティブAIツールについて情報筋が説明、簡単な記事作成に使用予定、グーグルは小規模出版社にフィードバック料を支払う（Alex Kantrowitz/Big Technology）
item.description:
Alex Kantrowitz / Big Technology:
Sources describe Google's generative AI tools for publishers, intended to be used for simple write-ups; Google is paying small publishers for feedback  —  Google wants to help journalists write stories with generative AI.  Will it succeed?  —  ∙ Paid

item.title: デイリー・ワイヤーと右翼コメンテーターのキャンディス・オーウェンズが、彼女の反ユダヤ主義的な発言をめぐる数カ月の論争の末に関係を解消（Isaac Schorr/Mediaite）
item.description:
Isaac Schorr / Mediaite:
The Daily Wire and right-wing commentator Candace Owens end their relationship after months of controversy over her antisemitic comments  —  The Daily Wire and controversial right-wing commentator Candace Owens parted ways on Friday, according to CEO Jeremy Boreing.

item.title: NBCニュースが元RNC議長のロナ・マクダニエルをNBCとMSNBCのオンエア・コントリビューターに起用、NBCでのデビューは3月24日放送の「ミート・ザ・プレス」（マイケル・M・グリンバウム／ニューヨーク・タイムズ紙）
item.description:
Michael M. Grynbaum / New York Times:
NBC News hires former RNC Chair Ronna McDaniel as an on-air contributor for NBC and MSNBC; her NBC debut will be on the March 24 edition of Meet the Press  —  Her new role as a commentator on NBC and MSNBC programs comes shortly after she stepped down as the leader of the Republican National Committee.

item.title: Metaは、iOSとAndroidのThreadsアプリで政治的コンテンツのオプションを展開し、ユーザーに「制限する」か「制限しない」かを選択させる（Lance Whitney/ZDNet）
item.description:
Lance Whitney / ZDNet:
Meta is rolling out a political content option in the Threads app for iOS and Android, letting users choose between “limit” or “don't limit”  —  With the 2024 US presidential election coming up, you can expect to see a lot more political posts on social networks, including Meta's Threads.

item.title: 情報源OpenAIは、ハリウッドのスタジオやメディア幹部などと会談し、映画制作者にSoraを作品に組み込むよう促すためのパートナーシップを構築している（Bloomberg）。
item.description:
Bloomberg:
Sources: OpenAI is meeting with Hollywood studios, media executives, and others to form partnerships to encourage filmmakers to integrate Sora into their work  —  - Startup pitching its new AI video generation tool, Sora  — CEO Altman attended LA parties during Oscars weekend

item.title: APとテキサス・トリビューンがコンテンツ共有契約を締結、APはトリビューンのテキサス州に関する報道を配信し、トリビューンはAPの移民報道へのアクセスを得る（AP通信）
item.description:
The Associated Press:
The AP and Texas Tribune enter a content sharing agreement; AP will distribute Tribune reporting on Texas and Tribune will get access to AP immigration coverage  —  The Associated Press and The Texas Tribune today announced a content sharing agreement, in which both organizations will benefit from each other's journalism.

item.title: ドナルド・トランプのトゥルース・ソーシャル社は、DWACの株主の承認後、SPAC合併により上場する。
item.description:
Dan Primack / Axios:
Donald Trump's Truth Social is going public via a SPAC merger after DWAC shareholders approved the move; TMTG will be listed on the Nasdaq as early as next week  —  - As Axios reported earlier today, this ends a multiyear saga that's included civil lawsuits, criminal lawsuits, closing extensions and vote postponements.
